channel.title: Biggest RSC Server?
channel.description: What's the biggest RSC server, that's been up the longest, and is looking to stay up even longer? I'm playing RSCEmulation, but, the community is full of douchebaggery. With only about 100ish people on daily, if you guys could help me/redirect me to a more active RSC server, with maybe 200 + 300 active people, and a nice friendly community. Please do so.

item.title: Biggest RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @Vibes Vibes
item.description:
@Vibes wrote:

well on this not im hoping for the best outcome possible bc angel is what it is period

Read full topic

item.title: Biggest RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @dexto dexto
item.description:
@dexto wrote:

[quote=“Vibes, post:36, topic:401119”]right now rsce is the best bc its the biggest. no one wants to play a server that has 10-20 people on it. having said that i hope that “they” make a server that Has everything the same as thee orginal runescape classic, which rscAngel was the private server that seem to do that. i personally have been waiting and waiting for a server like angel to come back out, but i have yet to see it. if this such server did come out, it, would be the best.
Does anyone know of anything going on behind the scenes ?
if not, i should look into creating… it would take years, but it would be worth it.[/quote]
There is a resurrection going on.
#rscangel @ rizon

Read full topic

RuneScape Classic - A fantasy MMORPG Adventure

Play the first version of RuneScape, released in 2001. Experience all the original content including 50 quests, 7 skills and 2D sprite-based graphics

item.title: Biggest RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:

You think its a coincidence that a player on your server said that rscr was better than rscr started getting ddosed after getting banned?
Sounds like a total coincidence to me.

Tbh so many kids can access shell booters and shit now, you can’t really pin point a ddos on to someone now unless they admit it. Shouting rscr is better could easily annoy someone who plays rsce and they start attacking the server that was advertised.[/quote]Yea, totally makes sense bro, totally.

item.title: Biggest RSC Server?
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

[quote=“5 1, post:25, topic:401119”][quote author=NoLives link=topic=498178.msg3645869#msg3645869 date=1309368932]

[quote author=5 1 link=topic=498178.msg3645736#msg3645736 date=1309360871]

Biggest server? RSCE.
RSCE the best server? no.

What’s the best server then? RscReloaded or Classic PK?

And the majority seem to disagree with you.

For what it’s worth, on RSC there wasn’t private servers, everyone was forced to play if they wanted to play RSC, regardless if they thought the rates were too slow or drops were too hard to achieve.

On RSC private servers, they’ve played numerous servers with fast rates, slow rates and every other combination you can think of. If they disagree with that particular servers rates or how it’s run they simply don’t play. That means that there’s 100-250 players online RSCEmulation at any given time but probably hundreds of other people who disagree with how it’s run just waiting for something else.

However, half of them would probably like an exact, identical RSC replica, the other half would prefer faster rates… I tried to go in the middle with a medium XP rate but people still think it’s either way too fast or way too slow and don’t bother playing. Private servers have given players a choice and an opinion basically. There will never be one central server because not everyone agrees with how it should be run.

I’ve provided RSCE for nearly 2 years now yet still some people would prefer a new server to come out with no proven history, no guarantee that it will be up for longer than a month and so on… As I said before if people really cared about the community they would go for a centralized server but that’s not the case. I think for most people it’s just the excitement of something new, the drama of it collapsing/being hacked and what not.

CodeForFame has said numerous times that he would never work using a RSCD based source, which is why he started working on RSCBase (but never finished it), but here’s an opportunity of a bit of power/reputation and he’s bang on it… It’s also amusing at how everyone seems to approve of this even though every server he’s worked on he’s exploited in one way or another, giving himself billions on Project P2P for example… It would be so easy to slip a line of code in somewhere that no-one would ever notice to give yourself a huge advantage, regardless whether it’s open source or not.

It’s funny, because I started working on this, and just the other day I found myself complaining about RSCD. At this point the server is pretty much done, so I can start working on an alternative. Also, there is only one reason why I started, and that’s because I thought other people would actually be working on it. At this point it’s clear that no one is going to work on it until it’s up and running, and even then I’m not too optimistic…

As for exploiting server, don’t even go there, you’re making it out to be a completely selfish act, when that’s not even close to reality. Anyway, the whole project is open source, do you really think I’d have be stupid enough to try and slip one past, especially when they can see the commit history, and I’m waiting at least 24 hours before I accept my own pull requests?
[/quote]Once again.
If you take out the competition, it’s not suprising that you think you’re the best.

Isn’t that 1 of the main goals when you start a business? Take out all of the other competition any way possible…
[/quote]That’s the goal if you’re a low-life that knows his stuff is going to fail with the least of competition.
Taking out competition of rsc private servers is(or already has) going to end up hurting everybody, even the person doing it.

If you’re gonna be making a huge profit, the last thing you care about is killing the “rsc scene”[/quote]And that is exactly why rsce isnt the best.

Read full topic

item.title: Biggest RSC Server?
item.description:
@5_1 wrote:

[quote=“NoLives, post:24, topic:401119”][quote author=5 1 link=topic=498178.msg3645736#msg3645736 date=1309360871]

[quote author=NoLives link=topic=498178.msg3645467#msg3645467 date=1309337484]

Biggest server? RSCE.
RSCE the best server? no.

What’s the best server then? RscReloaded or Classic PK?

And the majority seem to disagree with you.

For what it’s worth, on RSC there wasn’t private servers, everyone was forced to play if they wanted to play RSC, regardless if they thought the rates were too slow or drops were too hard to achieve.

On RSC private servers, they’ve played numerous servers with fast rates, slow rates and every other combination you can think of. If they disagree with that particular servers rates or how it’s run they simply don’t play. That means that there’s 100-250 players online RSCEmulation at any given time but probably hundreds of other people who disagree with how it’s run just waiting for something else.

However, half of them would probably like an exact, identical RSC replica, the other half would prefer faster rates… I tried to go in the middle with a medium XP rate but people still think it’s either way too fast or way too slow and don’t bother playing. Private servers have given players a choice and an opinion basically. There will never be one central server because not everyone agrees with how it should be run.

I’ve provided RSCE for nearly 2 years now yet still some people would prefer a new server to come out with no proven history, no guarantee that it will be up for longer than a month and so on… As I said before if people really cared about the community they would go for a centralized server but that’s not the case. I think for most people it’s just the excitement of something new, the drama of it collapsing/being hacked and what not.

CodeForFame has said numerous times that he would never work using a RSCD based source, which is why he started working on RSCBase (but never finished it), but here’s an opportunity of a bit of power/reputation and he’s bang on it… It’s also amusing at how everyone seems to approve of this even though every server he’s worked on he’s exploited in one way or another, giving himself billions on Project P2P for example… It would be so easy to slip a line of code in somewhere that no-one would ever notice to give yourself a huge advantage, regardless whether it’s open source or not.

It’s funny, because I started working on this, and just the other day I found myself complaining about RSCD. At this point the server is pretty much done, so I can start working on an alternative. Also, there is only one reason why I started, and that’s because I thought other people would actually be working on it. At this point it’s clear that no one is going to work on it until it’s up and running, and even then I’m not too optimistic…

As for exploiting server, don’t even go there, you’re making it out to be a completely selfish act, when that’s not even close to reality. Anyway, the whole project is open source, do you really think I’d have be stupid enough to try and slip one past, especially when they can see the commit history, and I’m waiting at least 24 hours before I accept my own pull requests?
[/quote]Once again.
If you take out the competition, it’s not suprising that you think you’re the best.

Isn’t that 1 of the main goals when you start a business? Take out all of the other competition any way possible…
[/quote]That’s the goal if you’re a low-life that knows his stuff is going to fail with the least of competition.
Taking out competition of rsc private servers is(or already has) going to end up hurting everybody, even the person doing it.[/quote]
If you’re gonna be making a huge profit, the last thing you care about is killing the “rsc scene”

Read full topic

Biggest server? RSCE.

And the majority seem to disagree with you.

For what it’s worth, on RSC there wasn’t private servers, everyone was forced to play if they wanted to play RSC, regardless if they thought the rates were too slow or drops were too hard to achieve.

On RSC private servers, they’ve played numerous servers with fast rates, slow rates and every other combination you can think of. If they disagree with that particular servers rates or how it’s run they simply don’t play. That means that there’s 100-250 players online RSCEmulation at any given time but probably hundreds of other people who disagree with how it’s run just waiting for something else.

However, half of them would probably like an exact, identical RSC replica, the other half would prefer faster rates… I tried to go in the middle with a medium XP rate but people still think it’s either way too fast or way too slow and don’t bother playing. Private servers have given players a choice and an opinion basically. There will never be one central server because not everyone agrees with how it should be run.

CodeForFame has said numerous times that he would never work using a RSCD based source, which is why he started working on RSCBase (but never finished it), but here’s an opportunity of a bit of power/reputation and he’s bang on it… It’s also amusing at how everyone seems to approve of this even though every server he’s worked on he’s exploited in one way or another, giving himself billions on Project P2P for example… It would be so easy to slip a line of code in somewhere that no-one would ever notice to give yourself a huge advantage, regardless whether it’s open source or not.

It’s funny, because I started working on this, and just the other day I found myself complaining about RSCD. At this point the server is pretty much done, so I can start working on an alternative. Also, there is only one reason why I started, and that’s because I thought other people would actually be working on it.
